intro: Hieracium pilosella subsp. trichophorum, commonly known as the hairy hawkweed, is a perennial herbaceous plant belonging to the family Asteraceae. It is characterized by its basal rosette of hairy, lance-shaped leaves and produces yellow flowers in a flat-topped cluster. The plant typically grows in open, disturbed sites such as roadsides and meadows, preferring well-drained soils. It is native to Europe and parts of Asia, and it is known for its ability to thrive in a variety of environmental conditions. The subspecies trichophorum is distinguished by its dense, white to greyish pubescence on the leaves and stems.
